instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: i get a amber light for power, board was water damaged, around smc, r5177 -5180 all burned /missing, replaced with good resistors , trace gone at r7516, r8141 was gone. i get 16.4v ppdcin_g3h i get 0v on pp5v_s4rs3. i noticed on alot of the enable lines im getting half a volt.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: PPBUS, 3V3_S5 present? The usual suspects inspected, U1900, U1950, U6100 and termination resistors and traces, J6100. Probably crap under the SMC too if liquid was nearby.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: .63v on PP3V3_S5, tried to reflow smc but no change  how is .63v possible on a 3v rail?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: PPBUS? Green orange light even present? Diagnose before just doing a reflow, now there is another variable introduced.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: yes i have orange light, .had orange light from start. with all the corrosion around smc i knew i had to reflow.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: 8.59 PPBUS at f7700

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: S5_PWR_EN present? If no the probably still crap under SMC, pull and reball. If it is present problem will be around TPS51980, commonly corroded trace to pin 23.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: im getting 1.7v on pin 2 of r8140 but 3.4v on pin 1, i replaced that resistor from another board, is that voltage right? pin 2 on r8140 goes to s5_pwr_en. r8140 and r8141 were gone when i looked at the board, repaired a trace to r8141 and replaced both resistors.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: 1.7V is way too low. The voltage drop over that resistor is way too high. Either the resistor is dead or there is something pulling it down. Resistance to GND on pin 2?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: i may have put the wrong resistor there, the schematics say 100 but not 100 of what, do you know what the resistor is, ill have to pull one from another board

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: sorry my replys take a bit. ive been doing multiple devices, iphone screen replacements, ipad 5th gen screen, have to balance the board work with priority work

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: 100 means 100 Ohm.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: my bad i replaced it with a 100k replaced with right value, now im getting 3.4v on pin 21 of u7501. im getting 1v on c7500 but im getting 8.2v on C7541 and 0v on c7503

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message:
im getting 1v on c7500 but im getting 8.2v on C7541

Your answer is right there.

But it also seems your PPBUS is at 8.2V which you said was 8.6V earlier.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: if they are right next to each other how can it be so low, that would mean something is pulling it down. dont caps short directly to ground so i would get 0v. im assuming c7500 is partly bad?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: I'm assuming a corroded trace.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: is there a way to fine the corroded trace? i have been over this board several times and have yet to find anything that looks corroded. anything that had ive already fixed

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: You can fix a corroded trace by soldering a wire from point A to point B (In your case from C7541 to C7500), its most likely internal so this is the only option.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: sweet, that had worked. i had power, ran it threw ultrasonic, tested, still worked, put it in housing and it stopped working, took it out, tested still dead. i have 8.6v on c7500, 3.3v on c7503, 3.4v on r8140, 1.5v on r7506 instead of 3.3v, 0v on r7551. could the chip be bad? all my problems seam to be around this chip

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: 3V3 present on L7560?

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: yes i have 3.3v on l7560

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: Could be corrosion anywhere. Check the usual suspects, U1900, U1950, J6100, U6100 and termination resistors/traces.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: where does PP5V_S4RS3 come from and what can i do to create it? i checked all 4 locations only thing i noticed out of place was r6117 was disconnected, from both sides. replaced and retraced, and i have 3.3v running threw it now, but still no change. sucky part is that it was working, once i ran the line. it powered, now something somewhere else went out and i feel it may be internal.

threads.title: 820-00165 no power
threads.message: The whole power cycle is not even starting if you have no pulses on 5V rail. Could be SMC, CPU or anything in between. This one will suck. Make VERY sure you have no pulsing or even one pulse when connecting power. Pretty impossible to catch on a slow multimeter, use a scope.
